page.title: 08AN INTERVIEW
page.content: Mrs Edna Perline James Campbell was the first of her family to emigrate from Jamaica to England. On arriving in this country in 1961 she found she had to get used to a new way of life in a much colder country. Finding work was not easy,and it was a year before she found a job in a diecasting factory making aircraft parts. She then stopped work for a while and more of her family joined her from Jamaica. Later she found work in a local hospital as a nurse and remained there until she settled down to raise a family. Later Mrs James decided to go to college. Twenty four years after arriving in the U.K. Mrs James has a family of four and teaches needlework in Wolverhampton.
